description:
_add_instance_faults() in servers.py stuffs 'fault' into instance dicts:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/38813/

This will need to be fixed before we can convert everything to internal objects.
title: OS API stuffs 'fault' into instance object

comments.content:
_add_instance_faults() in servers.py stuffs 'fault' into instance dicts:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/38813/

This will need to be fixed before we can convert everything to internal objects.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~cbehrens

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
Review: https://review.openstack.org/33552

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/33552
Committed: http://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/9c99ba9ac7195627b8eaf679e80c92a80fbbc5e2
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 9c99ba9ac7195627b8eaf679e80c92a80fbbc5e2
Author: Dan Smith <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Jun 18 13:58:33 2013 -0700

    Add Instance.fault
    
    This makes Instance load fault as an optional attribute, if
    requested. I didn't implement save for this, as I'm not sure
    we will (want to) support setting instance faults via that
    interface.
    
    Related to unified-object-model
    Fixes bug 1192004
    
    Change-Id: I581e1f49c4c593ece97cf32dc7cea3f7a7cbd953
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
